page.title: 19SLEAFORD REMEMBERED
page.content: THIS WAS WRITTEN AFTER TALKING TO AN ELDERLY LADY FROM SLEAFORD.SHE REMEMBERED THAT SLEAFORD USED TO BE A VERY BUSY MARKET TOWN.THE WHOLE OF THE TOWNS PEOPLE WOULD MEET FOR THE MARKET ON A MONDAY.NEAR THE MARKET WAS A CORN EXCHANGE WHERE THE TOWNS FARMERS WOULD MEET AND EXCHANGE CORN.IT WAS ALSO USED AS A TOWN HALL AND LOCAL MEETINGS AND DANCES WERE HELD THERE.THE CORN EXCHANGE STILL STANDS TODAY ALTHOUGH IT HAS CHANGED A BIT INSIDE AND OUT. IF THERE WAS A SPELL OF HOT WEATHER A CART WOULD COME ROUND AND SPRINKLE,THE ROADS WITH WATER TO STOP THEM BECOMNG DUSTY AND CRACKED. SLEAFORD AS WITH MOST MARKET TOWNS HAD A TOWN CRIER HE USED TO STAND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STREET AND SHOUT OUT THE TOWNS NEWS. {ALISON REAR AGE(15)}
